nodes.bodyText: With more than 2-4 queues this is gonna go wrong.
There is space for six. Or do you mean something else?
Is there space for six queues also on a width of 768?
what controller?
Just realized this line is never used. Must be slipped in by mistake.
countryFlagService.loadCountryFlag(StringUtils.isEmpty() ? ... : ...)
Sorry, I don't get it
This is very hard to read as you have duplicated code. You don't need to list countryFlagService.loadCountryFlag() twice. Just do the teneray operator on the country string.
Caps breaks with the UI style of the rest of the client
A lot of this breaks with the ui style of the client. It needs the new font to look good, but we cant have everything be small letters that looks weird for important texts.
I'd remove the Forged alliance forever, this isn't the only way to play

Having the single short word "play" on this button looks stupid. But I am open for alternatives.
And it is the primary intended way, though.

I don't know why we would write Play here anyways. The user is in the play tab and click on matchmaking. And they are obviously running the Forged Alliance Forever client.
Usually a button is labled as what it does. And in this case, it joins a queue.
this is not really ready anymore

I agree. But at the moment the server requires this button to be pressed before selecting the queues. I think it's planned to change that already? Maybe we should rename the technical name of this button when it is clear what is new purpose will be.

The ready checks are actually ignored by the server right now, and I think we are going to end up scrapping them entirely. (We will do ready checks on a per match basis rather than a per party basis, so there will be a different UI responsible for handling them).
So is the client responsible for the behaviour that you have to press the ready/play button first?

No. The queue may be joined without any ready checks. Apparently the ready checks were more of a "premature feature" which we don't need but Geo though we might need in the future so he built them in. But now it turns out we don't need them so we're gonna remove them again.
hardcoded

nodes.bodyText: Why caps lock?

I second this.
About merging, there arr multiple very debatable design choices I would like to discuss before merging.

The design uses uppercase. There is a css command to style a text uppercase or lowercase, but guess what, javafx doesn't support that command. :(
We could maybe have the message in lowercase and convert it to uppercase in the controller, but I don't know if that is a better solution.
About the design choices, it is best to have this discussion on zulip together with biass.
U know you can do List just be parsed correctly. If not you need to make some annotation
Same here
@FXML would be needed if the properties were private
